hints.content:
Numbers are equivalent when they represent the same place on the number line.

Let's compare each point to $\blueD{\dfrac23}$ and find the equivalent fraction.

options.alt: Two rectangles sit on top of each other. The top rectangle shows one whole divided into three equal parts. Each part is labeled one-third. Two parts are shaded. The rectangle on the bottom shows one whole divided into four equal parts. Each part is labeled one-fourth. Two parts are shaded. A number line below the rectangles shows tick marks above the number line from zero-thirds to three-thirds and tick marks below the number line from zero-fourths to four-fourths. A blue point appears at the tick mark two-thirds. A green point appears at the tick mark two-fourths. The green point is to the left of the blue point. !

Two rectangles sit on top of each other. The top rectangle shows one whole divided into three equal parts. Each part is labeled one-third. Two parts are shaded. The rectangle on the bottom shows one whole divided into eight equal parts. Each part is labeled one-eighth. Six parts are shaded. A number line below the rectangles shows tick marks above the number line from zero-thirds to three-thirds and tick marks below the number line from zero-eighths to eight-eighths. A blue point appears at the tick mark two-thirds. A purple point appears at the tick mark six-eighths. The purple point is to the right of the blue point. !

Two rectangles sit on top of each other. The top rectangle shows one whole divided into three equal parts. Each part is labeled one-third. Two parts are shaded. The rectangle on the bottom shows one whole divided into six equal parts. Each part is labeled one-sixth. Four parts are shaded. A number line below the rectangles shows tick marks above the number line from zero-thirds to three-thirds and tick marks below the number line from zero-sixths to six-sixths. A blue and pink point appears at the tick mark two-thirds, which is the same as four-sixths. !

hints.content: $\maroonD{L}$ is located at the same point on the number line as $\blueD{\dfrac23}$.

The following number line is equivalent to $\dfrac{2}{3}$.

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A number line that has moving left to right, a starting point at 0, three unlabeled tick marks, a tick mark at point L, an unlabeled tick mark and an ending tick mark at 1. !

question.content:
**Which number line shows a number equivalent to $\dfrac{2}{3}$? **

[[☃ radio 2]]

choices.content: ![A number line that has moving left to right, a starting tick mark at 0, three unlabeled tick marks, a tick mark at point L, an unlabeled tick mark and an ending tick mark at 1.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/64212a547418f1f1bb25be213123a3eedd45bd47)

![A number line that has moving left to right, a starting tick mark at 0, an unlabeled tick mark, a tick mark at point M, an unlabeled tick mark, and an ending tick mark at 1.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/cacf7c824bbcb20fd5fde1659ed02728bf15d924)

![A number line that has moving left to right, a starting tick mark at 0, five unlabeled tick marks, a tick mark at point N, an unlabeled tick mark, and an ending tick mark at 1.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/4b32b721be86f45cfcba24fe4d1c71ee07f80654)
